narratives.question_text: Please rate and comment on the following aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Workload
comments: This course was some of the best work I've ever had for a theater class and the most applicable to life. Unfortunately this course wasn't counted towards my GPA even though it was great to do case studies and discuss/read actual contracts from the business.
Workload was appropriate to the number of sessions held.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Organization.Comments:
comments: No syllabus, but that didn't really bother me. It would be great, however, to have access to the letters on the classes v2 website. Really enjoyed having examples from current LORT issues happening in the field!

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: the Instructor.Comments:
comments: No one knows the LORT handbook like Harry. You never know quite what to expect when you walk into class, but it's always an interesting discussion.
I truly appreciated Harry's knowledge of the CBA and the stories that accompanied his teaching. They really helped the CBA come alive and made class very interesting.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on: Visitors, if any
Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Your Learning.Comments:
comments: I will absolutely use this material during my career. A lot more than I would use any of the things i've learned in previous Yale theatrical courses.

I expect to go back to some of the letters we had to write for Harry at some point during my career (I think Harry liked at least one of my letters...)Going through the Equity handbook and getting a clearer understanding of why certain provisions exist and when to favor practice over the verbatim rule is hugely important to what I'm doing in my work assignment, as well as I when I leave Yale and go out into the field.
I appreciated the opportunity to go through the CBA in detail and I am sure I will reference my notes for years to come.
